III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section Program statement
Description (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There are concerns with the facility's medical staff conducting
medication reviews without parent/guardian or therapist present.
Floor staff are not properly trained to handle the youth. This place
is very wild and unprofessional There's lack of structure.
Investigation Complainant was anonymous.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed via telephone on
08/22/2025. Foster Care Worker reported Youth B has been
placed at the facility for one year. She said Youth B has not had
any medication changes; however, she has not been notified
when medication reviews are scheduled. Foster Care Worker
expressed no other concern regarding staff or the facility.
Administrator was interviewed at the facility on 08/25/2025 and
on 09/10/2025. Administrator reported the clinical team and
therapist coordinate schedules with the parent/guardian for
medication reviews. Administrator denied any incidents or
concerns regarding direct staff not being properly trained to
handle youths. Administrator reported the facility has managers
and safety support coordinators that work directly with the staff on
the pods to provide support and coaching. He said the agency is
putting a lot of focus on training staff working together to provide
support and ensure staff have the appropriate training to provide
youths with care and supervision. Direct care staff must complete
all new hire training before they can work on the pods.
Administrator was not aware of any incident where staff were
unable to control the youths.
Nurse was interviewed on 8/25/2025 and on 09/10/2025. Nurse is
the head nurse for both facilities. She reported medication reviews
are scheduled with the psychiatrist and are entered in the shared
calendar for the therapist to notify the parent/guardians. She said
when medication changes are made, the forms are sent to the
parent/guardians to sign before medications can be changed. She
said no new medication can be prescribed without the
2

parent/guardian approval. Nurse denied witnessing or youths
reporting staff are unable to control the youths.
Therapist was interviewed at the facility on 08/26/2025 and on
9/29/2025. Therapist reported the facility has two psychiatrists that
completed medication reviews. She reported that youths’
medication reviews are scheduled by the nurse and entered in the
shared calendar. The therapist or case manager are present for
medication reviews and notify the parent and worker if a
medication change is requested by the psychiatrist. She said
typically it is hard to get the worker and parent to participate in the
appointments because the medical team will schedule ten youths
to have the medication reviews and therefore, they are not
provided with the exact time of the appointment. This makes it
challenging to get the youth’s workers and parents to participate
during the appointment. She said the facility is trying to coordinate
with the medical team to come up with a more accurate schedule
to accommodate the parents and workers that want to be present
for the medication review. She is not aware of any incident where
medication was added without parental/guardian authorization.
She said written authorization is not required when the psychiatrist
discontinues medication.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 08/26/2025. Youth A
has been at the facility for 10 months. Youth A reported there are
always two staff on the pod, staff provide support and redirect
youths if they get into fights. Youth denied any concern regarding
staff.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 08/26/2025. Youth B
has been at the facility for one year. Youth B reported he is
participating in individual and group therapy, he takes medication
and gets his medication daily, gets enough to eat, participate in
activities outdoor and in the gym, and is attending school. Youth
B expressed no concerns regarding supervision or staff.
Youth C was interviewed at the facility on 08/26/2025. Youth C
has been at the facility for nine months. Youth C reported there
are always two staff members on the pod, and the staff verbally
redirect youths when they break the rules. Youth C denied witness
staff not being able to control the youths or are unprofessional.
Youth reported all his needs are being met, and he feels safe.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 08/26/2025. Staff 1 has
been working at the facility for one year. Staff 1 works 2nd shift and
works with most of the direct care staff and denied witnessing or
having any reports of staff not being able to control the youths.
Staff 1 reported the facility provides weekly training for staff and
3

holds monthly 1:1 supervision with direct care staff to provide
supervision to ensure staff have the necessary training and
support to provide care and supervision
Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility. Staff 2 has been working at
the facility for 2 years and works 1st shift. Staff 2 reported she
supervises Pod 7, and she has not witnessed direct care staff not
being able to handle the youths on the pod. She reported all staff
must complete new hire training before they work with youths.
Staff 2 reported the agency provides ongoing training for all staff
to ensure staff have the training and support to provide youths
with appropriate supervision.
Documents Reviewed:
• Spectrum Health Services Policy and Procedures states all
medication administrated to youth are to be ordered in
writing by the agency physician.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance based on interviews and
documentation provided. The facility policy does not require the
parent/guardian to be present for medication reviews, however if a
youth is prescribing a new medication parent/guardian is notified
and needs to consent to new medication.
Technical assistance was provided to the facility to improve the
scheduling for medication reviews, so that parents and guardians
can be notified when medication reviews are scheduled ahead of
time.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142
Section Health services; policies and procedures.
Description (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(e) Dispensing medication.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There is only one nurse on campus to care for 100 youth, and
many medication errors keep occurring.
Investigation Nurse was interviewed on 8/25/2025 and on 09/10/2025. She
reported she is the head nurse for both facilities and there are
three nurses and one medical assistance that order and fill
medication for the youths. She reported the nurse fills the
medication cart and the trained staff dispense the medication and
document in QuickMar. She said there are four staff trained to
4

pass medication for each building. She said in the month of
August there were some medication issues; on 08/12/2025 three
youths did not receive their 8pm medication, and on 08/08/2025
two youths did not receive their 8am medication. QuickMar
documentation was not recorded when youths refuse medication
or if medication was on the cart. There were four youths that had
missing dosage for the month of August. Nurse reported on
09/02/2025 staff missed passing the 1:30pm medication, because
staff were dealing with a situation. She said there were no youth
health referrals or incidents related to missing their medication.
Most of the medications missed were stimulants for afternoon
ADHD support. She said the medication concerns were discussed
during the management meeting and the management team is
working with the clinical team on a new process to address the
issues with medication dispensing.
Administrator was interviewed at the facility on 08/25/2025 and
he acknowledged there has been some concerns identified
regarding medication dispensing. He reported this was discussed
in the management meeting on 08/15/2025 and the clinical team
is working on developing a plan to address the concerns.
Administrator reported on 09/02/2025 the staff responsible for
medication dispensing were dealing with a situation and missed
dispensing 1:30pm medication. Administrator reported there are
three nurses and one medical assistant that work between both
facilities.
Youth A reported he takes medication and gets his medication
daily. Youth A did admit that sometimes he has refused to take his
medication.
Youth B and Youth C reported they takes medication in the
morning and evening. Youth B and Youth C denied any missed
medication.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 08/26/2025. She reported
she is trained in medication dispensing. She reported medication
cart is filled with the medication by the nurse. She said when she
is dispensing medication each youth is called to come to the med
cart on the pod, the medication is scanned and provided to the
youth. She said once the youth takes the medication she
documents in QuickMar medication status. She is not aware of
missed medication. She said sometimes if there is an issue with
QuickMar may not register the medication has been dispensed/or
the youth refused the medication. She said if a youth refuses the
medication, she documents that in QuickMar and has the youth
sign that they refused the medication.
5

Staff 2 is trained in medication dispensing. Staff 2 denied any
issues with medication being missing when she has dispensed
medication. She reported there have been incidents where youths
refuse medication, and she tries to ensure that it is documented in
QuickMar.
Documents Reviewed:
• Spectrum Medication Administration Procedure only shift
coordinators/managers and medical staff will dispense
medication. Dispense medication on time. Dispense the
medication from the youth’s individual packet into clear
medication cup. Count the number of pills to be given from
the medication book against the number of pills in the
medication cup. Stay with the youth until medication is
swallowed, check their mouth, hands, and cup to ensure
medication is taken. Complete the medication
administration record in the QuickMar system immediately
after distribution.
• Reviewed QuickMar record for August and found 4 Youths
had missed medication and it is not documented if youths
refused or the medication was missing.
• Medication irregularity report dated 09/02/2025 written by
Administrator noted the 1:30 pm medications were not
dispensed.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance in dispensing youths’
medication as prescribed based on interviews some youths did
not receive their prescribed medication.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
